skill.name: security-management
skill.description: Manage security policies, firewall zones, access control rules (ACLs), and guest network access. Perform comprehensive security audits and compliance reviews.
skill.summary: Manage UniFi network security including firewall zones, access controls, guest policies, and security audits.
skill.author: DataKnifeAI

security_audit.summary: All 23 static findings are false positives. The skill is a legitimate UniFi network security management tool. Detected patterns are metadata references (source_url, source_type) and markdown code formatting (backticks) in documentation. No malicious code patterns present.

content.value_statement: Network administrators struggle to maintain consistent security policies across distributed UniFi networks. This skill provides centralized management of firewall zones, access control rules, and guest network policies with automated compliance reporting.
actual_capabilities: List and view all firewall zones with their configuration details
Review and manage access control rules (ACLs) across the network
List and manage guest network hotspot vouchers with expiration tracking
Retrieve system information for security compliance verification
Generate comprehensive security audit reports with findings and recommendations
limitations: Requires authenticated access to a UniFi Network controller or UniFi OS console
Only displays information and does not modify firewall rules directly
Cannot create new firewall zones or ACL rules through this skill
Limited to read-only operations for security compliance and auditing purposes

use_cases.title: Quarterly Security Audit
use_cases.description: Network administrators use this skill to perform comprehensive security reviews. The skill lists all firewall zones, reviews ACL policies, checks guest access vouchers, and generates compliance reports with recommendations.

use_cases.title: Guest Network Management
use_cases.description: IT support staff use this skill to monitor guest network access. The skill lists active vouchers, shows expiration dates, and helps identify expired or expiring vouchers that need renewal.
use_cases.target_user: IT support teams and help desk personnel

use_cases.title: Network Segmentation Review
use_cases.description: Security analysts use this skill to assess network segmentation. The skill displays firewall zones, shows isolation policies, and helps verify that network segments are properly separated according to security requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Firewall Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me all firewall zones and their current configuration on our UniFi network.
prompt_templates.scenario: Getting started with security configuration review

prompt_templates.title: Access Control Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: List all access control rules (ACLs) on our UniFi network and explain what each rule controls.

prompt_templates.title: Guest Access Check
prompt_templates.prompt: List all active guest network vouchers. Which ones are expired or expiring soon?
prompt_templates.scenario: Monitoring guest network access and voucher lifecycle

prompt_templates.title: Complete Security Assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete security audit of our UniFi network. Include firewall zones, ACL rules, guest access vouchers, and provide a compliance summary with recommendations.

output_examples.input: Show me all firewall zones and their configuration
output: - Description: Guest WiFi network with internet access only
- Rules: Allow internet, Block all internal networks

output_examples.input: List all active guest network vouchers

output: - All zones have isolation policies enabled
- 2 rules allow traffic from Guest to Corporate (Flagged)
- Review ACL rules allowing Guest-to-Corporate traffic

best_practices: Review firewall zones and ACL rules quarterly to ensure they align with current security policies and network changes.
Monitor guest network voucher expiration dates and implement automated renewal notifications.
Document all security policy changes and maintain audit logs for compliance verification.
Apply the principle of least privilege when reviewing access control rules.
anti_patterns: Avoid using this skill to modify firewall rules without proper change control documentation.
Do not ignore expired guest vouchers as they may indicate unauthorized network access.
Avoid making changes during peak network usage hours without scheduling maintenance windows.
Do not rely solely on automated audits without periodic manual security reviews.

faq.question: What credentials does this skill need?
faq.answer: The skill requires API credentials for your UniFi Network controller or UniFi OS console. You will need to provide the base URL and API credentials through your Claude Code configuration.

faq.question: Can this skill modify firewall rules?
faq.answer: No. This skill is read-only for security purposes. It displays firewall zones, ACL rules, and guest vouchers but does not make any changes. Use the UniFi controller interface for modifications.

faq.question: How does this skill handle guest vouchers?
faq.answer: The skill lists active vouchers with their status, creation date, and expiration date. It can identify expired or expiring vouchers but cannot create, modify, or delete vouchers.

faq.question: What is included in a security audit?
faq.answer: A security audit includes firewall zone review, ACL rule analysis, guest network assessment, and compliance verification. The output provides a summary with findings and recommendations.

faq.question: Does this skill work with UniFi Dream Machine?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill works with any UniFi Network controller or UniFi OS-based device including UniFi Dream Machine, Dream Router, UniFi Console, and cloud-hosted controllers.

faq.question: How often should I run security audits?
faq.answer: Best practice is to run quarterly audits or after any network infrastructure changes. For high-security environments, monthly audits may be appropriate.
